channel.title: A few things
channel.description:
i need help understanding how to do a few things, the numbers are in order of importance to me
1. how do i spawn objects? when i open objects.cfg and type in the information none of them appear, and also, what exactly does everything mean? i got a rough idea but i'm not 100% sure 2. how do i change the ammount of damage a monster does 3. how do i make it so when you click on stairs it goes up and down, not just one way 4. why are there 2 objects.cfg and 2 items.cfg, one objects is in the data folder, one objects is in the config folder, one item is the data folder, and one of them is there when u first open the source (how u view everything)
if u can help i will gladly mod\admin u on my server

item.title: A few things
item.dc:creator: @candy candy
item.description:
@candy wrote:

[quote=“1080, post:4, topic:68552”][code]--------1. how do i spawn objects? when i open objects.cfg and type in the information none of them appear, and also, what exactly does everything mean? i got a rough idea but i’m not 100% sure

first of all to spawn and your an admin/mod type

::pickup "ID#" "amount"

corect

  1. how do i change the ammount of damage a monster does

second to change the dmg go to npc.cfg and search for the npc’s id # mess around with the health which is the last colum
and the lwoer the health the less dmg to open a .cfg open up notepad and drag the .cfg file onto notepad

  1. how do i make it so when you click on stairs it goes up and down, not just one way

this i dont know

  1. why are there 2 objects.cfg and 2 items.cfg, one objects is in the data folder, one objects is in the config folder, one item is the data folder, and one of them is there when u first open the source (how u view everything)

fourth if it is a .cfg file you open up notepad and drag the .cfg file onto notepad to open .class files find the .java form of it and edit the .java one and compile
---------------------------------------------------------------------[/code][/quote]

2 :

Its because you command is not set for the stairs to go up and down you have to set a command to make the stairs go up and down and if that doesnt work you can try copy pasting a command that makes it go up and down (Make sure u make a back up copy of ur file b4 doin this cause i dont wanna be held responsible for anything!)

Read full topic

item.title: A few things
item.description:
@1080 wrote:

[code]--------1. how do i spawn objects? when i open objects.cfg and type in the information none of them appear, and also, what exactly does everything mean? i got a rough idea but i’m not 100% sure

first of all to spawn and your an admin/mod type

::pickup "ID#" "amount"
  1. how do i change the ammount of damage a monster does

second to change the dmg go to npc.cfg and search for the npc’s id # mess around with the health which is the last colum
and the lwoer the health the less dmg to open a .cfg open up notepad and drag the .cfg file onto notepad

  1. how do i make it so when you click on stairs it goes up and down, not just one way

this i dont know

  1. why are there 2 objects.cfg and 2 items.cfg, one objects is in the data folder, one objects is in the config folder, one item is the data folder, and one of them is there when u first open the source (how u view everything)

fourth if it is a .cfg file you open up notepad and drag the .cfg file onto notepad to open .class files find the .java form of it and edit the .java one and compile
---------------------------------------------------------------------[/code]

Read full topic
